9jwfqLgYv_qzg-C7G1pMMg.text: A lovely setting for beautiful food, Antoinette is just the kind of cafe I would expect in posh Mandarin Gallery. From its lavish French decor to its many cream-based desserts, it probably does not come as a surprise that the prices are equally 'atas'. The one area that was lacking though is the service that could have been better suited to the environment. There seemed to be a shortage of staff the last time I went, and it not only took us awhile to be served, but the waitress did not seem very happy to be serving either.The desserts, in my opinion, are very French with lots of mousse and layered treats, and rather innovative and delicate-looking. The tastes had a few hits and misses. I quite liked Le Royale and most of their chocolate-based desserts. The earl grey in Antoinette was hardly there the first time I tried it but delightfully infused the second time. I did not like the Baba pastry very much. I would definitely be back, mostly for the ambience and the gorgeous desserts but I wouldn't go too often.

sqktPQ2H31f75k5NDcGDBQ.text: it's pricy.. but they have pretty good desserts.. i had one of their specials desserts that looked like a small coconut which was actually a chocolate shell filled with coconut mousse and filled topped with pineapple.. pretty tasty and not too sweetmy wife had a white chocolate mousse cake with berries which was also pretty goodmy coffee was meh.. but maybe i'm being a bit picky since i can get a great cup of joe in seattle

-aGn98HiBAqeLswmSDMNSw.text: One of the best crepes ever! Great place to grab a hot drink and a dessert after lunch or for a break from shopping. I think we found out perfect match when we saw nougatine. It's a crepe filled with Nutella and caramel. Has on top nougatine ice cream. Yummy as shown in the photo

BcWWeVlhwDjnAkkN0htxyw.text: The place was relatively empty for a weekday night. The selection of cakes on the display were rather limited. 2 of the cakes which I was planning to have were not available.Yuzu Green Tea Bubble Bath ($12++)Jasmine green tea with yuzu, dill, mango and lime meringueThe drink was part of the Dilmah Tea Inspired Menu from 1 June to 31 July. It was served with a rubber yellow duck sitting on the meringue. So cute looking. The drink was refreshing with cubes of mango sitting in the bottom. Interestingly it was not served with a spoon and had to request for one.French Toast with Ham and Cheese ($14++)Served with creme chantilly Brioche bread sandwiched with Swiss Gruyere  cheese cream, Paris ham served with salad tossed in house dressing.Could not taste the cheese cream in the bread, nor could see it. The bread looked average not the kind of brioche bread which I was expecting.Ondeh Ondeh Queen's Castella Cake ($11+)Made using fresh fragrant pandan leaf, and studded with gula melaka bits with hints of coconut.It was like pandan chiffon cake, with filling in between.

mjTVvXqK3xs27h9vJf0q_Q.text: Ordered their Antoinette's breakfast. Eggs are cooked nicely and tasty. Bacon are good too. Sausage are juicy. But the toast are quite hard to be cut though. Viennoiserie looks good but have to take them away as the main plate itself is quite filling for me. Friend ordered Pork Ragu Fusilli. I tried that too. It is also really nice. I'm contented. With the ambience too, everything are great !

photos.caption: Photo of Antoinette - Singapore, Singapore. Antoinette breakfast
Photo of Antoinette - Singapore, Singapore. Ambience
Photo of Antoinette - Singapore, Singapore. Hot chocolate

a-TaAkarwYzL9WqwB0uyIQ.text: If you like caramel, melted nutella, and a bit of saltiness then this crepe is for you. Nougatine, that's what my husband and I ordered. Of course, you will devour it with all your heart. My goodness, the combination was phenomenal. The light creaminess of the caramelized vanilla ice cream was perfect with the rest of goodness mentioned above. Also, the light/cooled/hardened toffee on top was a bonus. Didn't expect to stumble across a crepe that would satisfy my sweet tooth wholly. My husband and I loved it! I also had the Petal Rose tea with my crepe, it was pretty good.

9qiqHawB8jHMJHW8lCEB6g.text: Marronette ($55/$110) - 5 starsFrench chestnut creme Chantilly layered with chestnut cake, orange confit and black sugar crumble, perfumed with dark rumAnother pricey but delicious light cake.Opera matcha - 2.5 starsThe cake was light, the matcha flavor wasn't strong enough and my mom found it too sweet. An unremarkable cake.

Or-pHuO2PycRq8p-SwTFog.text: Located in Orchard, this French restaurant is a nice option in town if you want to experience an European setting without burning a hole in your wallet. Prices are not cheap but pretty decent given the nice ambience and dedicated service. I had the shrimp pasta. The pasta had absorbed the essence of the shrimps. It did seem a bit like Chinese style bee hoon which is a surprise but not deal breaker. The pancake with chocolate ice cream is really enjoyable and just nice for two people to share. I would certainly want to drop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of Antoinette - Singapore, Singapore. Pancake with chocolates

PX7o7kZKoH-l6ND3qmVRHg.text: It's funny how people still cannot differentiate the difference between a macaron and macaroon. When in doubt, always remember there is a dictionary or internet.So let me start by reviewing my favorite to go place to have a nice afternoon tea in Singapore. Antoinette ie. The decor, ambience and pastries, there is nothing I dislike about. I love them all. It is definitely the kind of place I feel in harmony with. If I ever have a cafe, I will model it after Antoinette.Antoinette to me is a place for pastries/tea, a place for great ambience and a place where girls can go and enjoy having a nice get together. Someone I know dislike the place, called the atmosphere at Antoinette too stuffy. Oh well, if one can't sit/behave properly, enjoys talking loudly/crudely or basically prefers fast food joints, this is definitely not a place I will suggest. The pastries, though not a huge variety, have always been very good. I am someone who always look for quality and not quantity. The orchid tea is excellent, something that I do not find it in anywhere else. The French toast with caramelized banana is to die for too.Service here ranged from good to very good. I wish the place takes reservation, I do not fancy standing in line at all. Looking forward to my next visit when I travel to Singapore. Hopefully, everything I love about Antoinette remains the same.

W8IMPpsu3kWfAeJmpMFGVg.text: Went on a weekend and waited 30 mins for the table and as soon as we sat down, the lady informed us that we have to spend $20 per head otherwise have to leave in 30 mins. We just found this ridiculous and unprofessional for a cafe. We would have spent around that much anyways but decided not to stay there and went to wild honey instead.

PpPZW7AsGD9cj0nLTJydXQ.text: Location: ExcellentFood: Wide selection of unique 'classy' dessert, tastes a little above average though, however the pricing is way beyond average. Basically you pay just for the ambiance and status, not the food. Their specialty is crêpe both sweet and savoury types.Drink: They have wide selection of hot teas as well and you are welcome to get a refill of hot water (if you don't share the tea). Cold drinks suck though.Ambiance: The interior design and tablewares make you feel like you're the most important person on earth. The decor is like classy french dominated concept that's perfect just for tea time. Price: Super premium.

photos.caption: Photo of Antoinette - Singapore, Singapore. The excellent dessert with bunch of meringues.

X0qK-S-EijuhC7fuOHDjdA.text: Pro:Ambience was decent, no much noiseSeafood Ogli was not badFrench Kiss tea was pretty good Con:Have to waitGarden of Antoinette was basically patches of grass with some roasted duck breast

Bp-kHA0y4w-hW4T356O26g.text: Quaint little cafe tucked on the top floor in Mandarin Gallery. Love their macaroon, especially the earl grey raspberry!Ambience is great for afternoon tea and chilling with a good friend for a hearty chat. It can get a little chilly so bring a sweater :)

T2xIei6cCyD7ZRw9GKhxSg.text: Antoinette is a really classy joint, with their matching monogrammed crockery and cutlery, and their plush sofa chairs. Named after the last queen of France, they serve all sorts of decadent pastries and desserts, as well as western cuisine.I was really impressed by the attention to detail. It felt very parisian and proper, which had very strange effects on me. I felt like I had to sit up straight, drink tea with my pinky finger raised and say "Oui" a lot. I ordered the Classic Eggs Florentine, and it came on a monogrammed plate, of course. The toasted brioche used was exceptionally good, the eggs perfectly poached, and the salad on the side was fresh and light, balancing my meal perfectly.I also had the French toast with salted caramel, which my taste buds adored. It came in 3 thick slices drizzled with maple syrup and a light dusting of icing sugar. Large dollops of crème chantilly, which is basically whipped cream. But at Antoinette, their whipped cream is extra creamy and rich!Coffee here was rather disappointing, even if it did come in a pretty monogrammed set. My pinky dinger refused to bend, no matter what I did.I would definitely recommend this place for a special date as the ambience is really more romantic and cosy. Or a girly tea gathering. Oui. It's not a big restaurant, so do make bookings if you are coming during peak hours on weekends especially. Will update my review once I try their dinner menu! :)

ytb1rQS3EOVzT3uePv4RXQ.text: The theme of this place is French/Royalty-Glamour - with a notion to take you back to the age of the last Queen of France, and be spoilt with French decadence. From the Versailles decor to the Menu - the place does reek of French design, classy and not gaudy. The line is very thin - but the restaurant manages to look chic and exude that seamlessly - from the cutlery, to the tea, to the service, etc. This place is famous for it's Macaroons, though I was so stuffed after dinner that I had no space for them. But my friend took some away! Like a whole box!!What I Love: The Menu has all-day breakfast, which I love. It wasn't the typical American breakfast, hash, etc. - but the eggs were semi-done, the bread was yummmmy... and the sausage was fresh and very very tasty. The main comes with bacon too, which I so loved! I got the set, the Antoinette's Breakfast - which comes with a main, pastries and a drink, for which I got the hot chocolate... it really was melted chocolate - and not just a standard mix. The last time I had such hot chocolate was in Paris itself!What I Don't Love: The prices. It's pretty steep.... like $20 for a main, if you get a set? But a set and a drink will set you back $25-$30.

hAShCua_WEqZA8JCs9n5kA.text: Went there for their all day breakfast, but it was disappointingly mediocre - I honestly could have done a better job. If you do visit this place for its gorgeous interior and plush furniture, have lunch elsewhere and come here after for a nice pastry and cup of tea (although very expensive).  The pastry selection on display just as you step into the entrance of the restaurant will make you drool! All sorts of croissants, tarts and macaroons are displayed with their buttery finishes and glazes shining under the light (seriously they were shining).  The service staff aren't very well trained though.  The waiter tried clearing my plate before I was finished and I had to stop him with my plate already mid way in the air cos he was so fast and didn't even ask if I was done, and when the bill came they had overcharged us by placing another item that we hadn't ordered on the bill. So do be careful to check your bill before paying!

xoD5DlkzNrQQTriz0NqBDg.text: With Chef Pang Kok Keong at the helm, Antoinette prides itself as the "quintessential Parisian pâtisserie" . According to her website, Antoinette "will set the benchmark for the pastry and dessert scene not only in Singapore, but also in the region with her takes on time-honoured French classic desserts". After reading this tremendous boast, one would expect this to be among the best pastry stores in Singapore. Unfortunately, they fell short.Enter the Antoinette, an earl grey infused chocolate mousse cake topped with raspberry coulis. While the mousse was smooth and luscious, the thick sac spoiled the experience for me. (Haha) I'm not sure what the deal with the sac was, but it was extremely hard to pop. Extracting the coulis while maintaining the integrity of the cake was a chore.When a consumer buys macarons, they look for the most aesthetically pleasing one. Unfortunately, most of the ones in Antoinette's display case had a bumpy surface. The dense macarons tasted as bad as they look.While it would be unfair to compare Antoinette to established tea salons such as Laduree, it is safe to say I won't be back.Don't believe the hype.Note:Props to the design & marketing team for trying to appeal to the francophile in us.

tCiLHSjwDadDR2jLMBM8Fg.text: I have heard a lot about Antoinette and have been looking forward to trying it as a Salon de Thé in Singapore is a rare concept. Having used to patronise Canele in the past, I was surprised to find many similar elements here as Canele. The crepes are presented in the same manner, and seeing the Strawberry Shortcake, Mont Blanc, Le Royale and certain macarons on the display was uncanny. However, Antoinette definitely covered the Salon de Thé vibe well, almost felt as if I was in France. The tea selection was extensive and the caramel tea I had matched my hopes exactly. Macarons were not bad either, though not the best I've tasted. The onion soup was a slight let down - although the flavour of the broth was good, I personally prefer a thicker and heartier soup, and the cheese crust that covered the top of the bowl did not do the soup any favours.

2K384gPd4uuU_DggvohwLw.text: Smoked salmon Blinis (16.50) ain't great, don't get them especially if you aren't a great fan of doughy pancakes! Hot chocolate (7.00) is pretty much a must try, not too sweet neither too thick and creamy, proportion + taste was 'just nice'! You wouldn't believe it, but It makes a good thirst quencher! Ps: love the interior decor with its fine upholstery. Absolutely comfortable and lovely! Simply Western :)

rkrqwy1oyChaX_-bCb00hA.text: This year, Antoinette has come up with 3 Christmas macarons along with 4 other Christmas cakes which are upsized versions of its regular petit cakes.Rum and raisin macaron/Fruit Cake/Orange Flower In all, these Xmas flavors like fruit cake are not exactly what I prefer but is certainly a welcome innovation. The macaron shells are slightly dry and hard. Hence they are fairly decent but not the best versions in town so far.

5WNAZ3XioUE3PMc-p2JKZw.text: This seemed like a very valiant effort to recreate Paris's Angelina in Singapore. The hot chocolate was excellent and the creme chantilly was unusually thick but still good. The Kyoto dessert was excellent. The aircon was on too high though.

a0PpUPtDfU4cAr8sDBgJ6Q.text: Alright food, great cakes, ...but bring a sweater.  The air conditioning in this place is set at below freezing, and apparently it cannot be adjusted :-s
